channel.title: [OPINION]User Interactions
channel.description:
Alright, this is mostly an opinion based thread where I'm looking for ideas.
For the project I've been working on, we've re-done walking to utilize WASD keys along with Q/E for camera rotation. The keys 1-8 on the numpad will activate items in your inventory (currently a hotbar style approach is being used).
I'm looking for more ideas as to what keys could be used to activate secondary features. Such as in Skyrim you can use e to talk with NPC's (we've suggested using space as an action button).
An action being defined as any interact-able NPC, object or feature in the game.
I'm looking for creative and well-thought out responses, please no spam.
EG: I suggest you make F1 an auto-afk button, your reasoning here.
EDIT: [img]http://desmond.imageshack.us/Himg513/scaled.php?server=513&filename=64494158.png&res=medium[/img]

item.title: [OPINION]User Interactions
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Tutorial:

For the “action” button I believe you should use the right click button, and the left click button for attacking. This would disable the possibility of right clicking, but you could make it to where shift-click and left click right clicks the enemy, or even better… pressing shift while hovering over an NPC.

Alright, would you remove the ability to have any keys allow for attacking? I can understand how it would be beneficial and harmful, so I’m wondering if what I spoke about earlier “universal action button” (spacebar) could be trouble-some. I’m not sure about the shift-click, I think that could be cumbersome in PvP situations. I like the thought that went into this post, thank-you.

ArticBlooms:

The “T” button could be the unviersal talk button as it would be the only button you really need. The spacebar could be used as an accept button if you were talking to someone. And you could let the players choose their top 4 teleport destinations in the beginning and let the keys 1,2,3,4 (or more if wanted) teleport them to their destinations.

Would the “T” merely activate an accessible dialogue or advance them? (From what I understand it’s merely to activate a dialogue, space to advance, I like that idea!)

I’m also really keen on that teleportation idea, the only modification I think I’m going to do would be to allow the radius of it to be more encompassing then just teleports. Any ideas?
